timeline.message: First impl of and tests for HelidonSimpleTimer
MP changes for metrics 2.3.2

Fix incorrect JSON keys; add a few missing additions of new simple timer to data structures

Signed-off-by: tim.quinn@oracle.com <tim.quinn@oracle.com>
Slight changes to fix omissions

Remove FinalRegistry and its use for the base registry; part of moving to MP metrics 2.3

Signed-off-by: tim.quinn@oracle.com <tim.quinn@oracle.com>
First impl of and tests for HelidonSimpleTimer
MP changes for metrics 2.3.2

Fix incorrect JSON keys; add a few missing additions of new simple timer to data structures

Signed-off-by: tim.quinn@oracle.com <tim.quinn@oracle.com>
Slight changes to fix omissions
Merge branch 'metrics-2.3' of github.com:tjquinno/helidon into metrics-2.3
Work-in-progress for triggering interceptor behavior for synthetically-annotated methods; not yet working
Concurrent changes
Changes to implement REST.request inferred metric on JAX-RS endpoints
Simplify logic for creating and updating synthetic REST.request SimpleTimer metric for each JAX-RS method
Fix synthetic simple metric name to include parameter types
Clarify synthetic, dynamically-added annotation added to JAX-RS endpoints to trigger REST.request SimpleTimer updates
A few improvements and comment changes
Add config control over synthetic SimplyTimed annos on JAX-RS endpoints; defaults to false

Some clean-up

Signed-off-by: tim.quinn@oracle.com <tim.quinn@oracle.com>
Update the TCK pom
Slight revision in tests
Concurrent changes
Add non-public method to retrieve MetricID/HelidonMetric pairs given a name
Make sure TYPE is emitted to Prometheus/OpenMetrics output only when requested

Fix behavior of /metrics/registryName/metricName to report all matching metrics

Signed-off-by: tim.quinn@oracle.com <tim.quinn@oracle.com>
Significant further steps in passing the 2.3 TCK
Undo temp change in module-info
Restore earlier blank in module-info
Concurrent changes
Move custom param converter and related logic from microprofile/metrics to microprofile/tests/tck/tck-metrics so it cannot even accidentally be used by developers
Expose a way to retrieve the current Helidon flavor from features
Add support for optional MP REST.request metrics from SE
Change config key used for controlling REST.request feature
Reflect change in config key controlling REST.request behavior
Update QuickStart examples for REST.request support
Fix typo in comments about which registry REST.request metrics appear in
Enable REST.request metrics in hello-world implicit and explicit examples
Update doc pages to reflect SimpleTimer and, for MP, SimplyTimed and REST.request metrics
Turn on REST.request support in MP quickstart archetype; remove SE quickstart uses of REST.request
Remove changes supporting SE implementation of REST.request convenience methods
Resolve deployment URI for Arquillian in optional TCK tests for REST.request tests
Fix incorrect change to HelidonFeatures; meant to remove the new method returning the current flavor but instead removed the method that sets the flavor -- which is essential
Remove now-unused setting for SE REST.request enable setting
Restore accidentally-removed exclusion
Fix typo in earlier correction
Explicitly disable REST.request support in MP examples and the MP bare archetype to emphasize that the feature is there without turning it on.
Some clean-up: remove unused code, etc.
Remove unused import
Fix typo in name
Fix missing blank line at end of file
Fix copyright errors

timeline.bodyText: Dim recollection here that this is quite expensive to invoke with every call; I seem to recall some other class that can be cached statically to give you a new builder.
timeline.author: ljnelson

replies.bodyText:
All of our metric implementations use the same pattern. The JSON field (somewhat misnamed) is declared this way:
static final JsonBuilderFactory JSON = 
    Json.createBuilderFactory(Collections.emptyMap());

IIRC the real performance drain was in the createBuilderFactory call but it probably would be good to review all uses of this pattern to see if we can speed things up.
replies.author: tjquinno

replies.bodyText: This is the way to do it. We need to cache the builder factory. JsonObjectBuilder itself is mutable and cannot be used from more than one thread (as it builds a single JSON Object).
replies.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: This is probably good enough.  Note that strictly speaking a JAX-RS annotation is one that is, in turn, annotated with HttpMethod.  I'd probably leave this line alone anyway.
timeline.author: ljnelson

replies.bodyText:
I want to make sure I understand.
I think you're suggesting that instead of iterating through the individual annotation classes {GET.class, etc.) to see if one is present on a given method we could look for HttpMethod.class`. Is that it?
Related, the @Observes @WithAnnotations clause currently lists the individual JAX-RS-related annotations (GET.class, etc.) in the method declaration. Could we also use  HttpMethod.class there?
replies.author: tjquinno

timeline.message: Add link to the metrics spec
Open microprofile/metrics to io.helidon.microprofile.cdi also
Fix module opens for integration tests
